html: Eduardo Rodriguez walks two batters after being ahead 0 for 2. Sox can't turn a double play. There's a stolen base and then the .162-hitting No. 8 hitter has a two-run single. Then a wild pitch and the No. 9 hitter singles in a run. The 2019 Red Sox. Catch the fever.
text:
Eduardo Rodriguez walks two batters after being ahead 0 for 2. Sox can't turn a double play. There's a stolen base and then the .162-hitting No. 8 hitter has a two-run single. Then a wild pitch and the No. 9 hitter singles in a run.

The 2019 Red Sox. Catch the fever.

html: When I started talking about the humanitarian and security nightmare in Yemen 4 years ago, few noticed. Thanks to @SenSanders @SenMikeLee and many others who joined the fight, Congress woke up. And just now the Senate voted to end our war in Yemen 54-46. Amazing.
text:
When I started talking about the humanitarian and security nightmare in Yemen 4 years ago, few noticed. 

Thanks to @SenSanders @SenMikeLee and many others who  joined the fight, Congress woke up. 

And just now the Senate voted to end our war in Yemen 54-46. 

Amazing.

#YemenCantWait

html: I'm on the Senate floor now urging my colleagues to support SJ Res 7, our War Powers Resolution to end US involvement in the war in Yemen. 85,000 children have died. The country is in the midst of a cholera epidemic. Today we have a chance to end our support for this nightmare.
text:
I'm on the Senate floor now urging my colleagues to support SJ Res 7, our War Powers Resolution to end US involvement in the war in Yemen. 

85,000 children have died. The country is in the midst of a cholera epidemic. Today we have a chance to end our support for this nightmare.

html: 8/ North Korea has a history of pretending to comply in order to get what it wants. It would be a catastrophe for Trump to sign a peace agreement, promise to withdraw troops, and give up all leverage while North Korea retains the capability to annihilate us or our allies.
text: 8/ North Korea has a history of pretending to comply in order to get what it wants. It would be a catastrophe for Trump to sign a peace agreement, promise to withdraw troops, and give up all leverage while North Korea retains the capability to annihilate us or our allies.

html: 7/ Trump's own intelligence experts concluded that North Korea's nuclear weapons program continued throughout the last year and that they remain "committed to developing a long-range, nuclear-armed missile that is capable of posing a direct threat to the United States."
text: 7/ Trump's own intelligence experts concluded that North Korea's nuclear weapons program continued throughout the last year and that they remain "committed to developing a long-range, nuclear-armed missile that is capable of posing a direct threat to the United States."

html: 6/ We know that's a possibility because that's exactly what happened at last year's summit. Trump lavished praise on Kim and halted important joint military exercises, without any meaningful commitment to denuclearization in return.
text: 6/ We know that's a possibility because that's exactly what happened at last year's summit. Trump lavished praise on Kim and halted important joint military exercises, without any meaningful commitment to denuclearization in return.

html: 5/ These are tangible steps North Korea could take to roll back its nuclear program that would merit corresponding commitments from the US and our allies. But the danger lies in Trump making big concessions to Kim without anything substantial in return.
text: 5/ These are tangible steps North Korea could take to roll back its nuclear program that would merit corresponding commitments from the US and our allies. But the danger lies in Trump making big concessions to Kim without anything substantial in return.

html: 4/ Permanent dismantlement of the nuclear facilities at Yongbyon, with international monitoring. And finally, a verifiable cap on North Korea’s nuclear warheads and delivery systems.
text: 4/ Permanent dismantlement of the nuclear facilities at Yongbyon, with international monitoring. And finally, a verifiable cap on North Korea’s nuclear warheads and delivery systems.

html: 3/ Next, a freeze on all weapons of mass destruction activities. Not just pausing nuclear tests - halting all enrichment activities, construction of new nuclear facilities, building of new missiles, developmental testing, and chemical and biological weapons programs.
text: 3/ Next, a freeze on all weapons of mass destruction activities. Not just pausing nuclear tests - halting all enrichment activities, construction of new nuclear facilities, building of new missiles, developmental testing, and chemical and biological weapons programs.

html: 2/ First, a signed joint declaration detailing a roadmap for continued negotiations, w milestones for verifiable progress, including firm dates for completion. The declaration should include a clear definition of the ultimate goal—not just vague references to “denuclearization.”
text: 2/ First, a signed joint declaration detailing a roadmap for continued negotiations, w milestones for verifiable progress, including firm dates for completion. The declaration should include a clear definition of the ultimate goal—not just vague references to “denuclearization.”

html: Twelve people were shot in Baltimore on Thursday. Twelve. In just one day. Five of them are dead. That’s more people than were killed by guns in Japan in all of 2017. It’s long past time for us to do something about gun violence in America.
text:
Twelve people were shot in Baltimore on Thursday. 

Twelve. 

In just one day.

Five of them are dead.

That’s more people than were killed by guns in Japan in all of 2017.

It’s long past time for us to do something about gun violence in America.

Nope. Iran's economy IS weaker, but Europe is ignoring U.S. sanctions, keeping their economy afloat. Trump's DoD confirms Iran's ability to maneuver in Syria hasn't been compromised at all. And hardliners in Tehran are gaining strength.

I've been sounding this alarm for years. But until recently, no one was paying attention.

So the offer now is that we give Trump his wall funding and he pays TSA and the Coast Guard for 21 days? And then when we build more wall, he pays them for another 21 days? Like a never ending installment plan? 

What a great deal for America!
